title: K-Pop Officially Becomes the #1 Music Genre Worldwide in 2025
shortdescription: BTS, BLACKPINK, and NewJeans drive K-pop past hip-hop and Latin music in global streams.
author: Ji-hoon Park

content.content: The IFPI Global Music Report 2025 just dropped a bombshell: K-pop has officially overtaken hip-hop and Latin music to become the most consumed music genre worldwide — a historic first.

K-pop accounted for 18.4% of all global recorded music streams in 2025 — up from 12.9% in 2024. Fourth-generation groups like NewJeans, IVE, and aespa dominated charts, while legacy acts BTS (on hiatus) and BLACKPINK still pulled massive numbers.
South Korea now exports more music revenue than Japan and the UK combined. HYBE alone reported profits higher than Universal Music Group’s entire North American division.
Industry experts predict by 2030, over 30% of the global Top 100 will be K-pop acts. The Hallyu wave isn’t slowing down — it’s just getting started.
